meanings.definition: A triangular gable found over a portico or window.
meanings.sent1: The pediments on top of the ancient buildings looked like triangles.
meanings.sent2: The architect included pediments in the design to add a classic touch.
meanings.sent3: The pediments seemed to be playing hide and seek with the clouds.
meanings.sent4: The pediments stood tall like guardians protecting the entrance.
meanings.sent5: The sharp angles of the pediments caught the sunlight beautifully.

meanings.definition: A low-pitched gable above a facade.
meanings.sent1: The pediments on the old house were gently sloping.
meanings.sent2: The pediments added a unique charm to the front of the building.
meanings.sent3: The pediments whispered secrets to the passing breeze.
meanings.sent4: The pediments hovered over the entrance like a welcoming embrace.
meanings.sent5: The soft curves of the pediments blended seamlessly with the architecture.
